metadata.Title: CVE-2017-9949 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description: The grub_memmove function in shlr/grub/kern/misc.c in radare2 1.5.0 allowsremote attackers to cause a denial of service (stack-based buffer underflowand application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via acrafted binary file, possibly related to a buffer underflow in fs/ext2.c inGNU GRUB 2.02.

criterions.comment: radare2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
